org.phoenixbioinformatics.proxy.cache
Class CacheManager

java.lang.Object
  org.phoenixbioinformatics.proxy.cache.CacheManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.EventListener, javax.servlet.ServletContextListener
public class CacheManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.servlet.ServletContextListener

A Singleton- and Mediator-pattern class that represents a collection of caches for the web application; it implements the ServletContextListener interface so that the container can instantiate the class on startup. It provides an API for the several caches, providing a simple interface for the paywall to call.

Author:
Robert J. Muller

isSubscribed

public boolean isSubscribed(java.lang.String ipAddress)
Is the input IP address in a currently subscribed range of IP addresses?

Parameters:
ipAddress - the IP address in quad format (123.456.789.012)
Returns:
true if there is an organization with an IP address range that includes the input address

Parameters:

Returns:

getAllowingRoles

public java.util.Set<Group.Role> getAllowingRoles(java.lang.String url)
Get the set of allowing roles for a URL. If the URL requires login, the method will return a collection, possibly empty indicating the default Community role. If the URL does not require login, the method returns null.

Parameters:
url - the URL to check
Returns:
true if login is required, false if not

ip - the quad IP address
Returns:
OK, WARN, or REFUSE
